column4: is there a file which saves the gui preferences for nautilus?
is there a file which saves the gui preferences for nautilus? ..and if so where is it?
gconf-editor
thanks, my problem is that nautilus starts with the default layout and i thought it might be due to wrong user rights..
define 'default layout'
gconf-editor is a gui frontend to edit the gconf.xml file
which lives somewhere in a users home folder
i wonder though if it's due to file ownership or if it's something else..started like a day ago for the first time
have you tried killing the nautilus process then restarting it while you have system-monitor open to show open files?
thus showing you which files it's using
in any case the gconf stuff lives in ~/.gconf
i get some error messages: trayzz@tray:~$ nautilus&
i tried it now, got some error messages
I'll send you a private message if you don't mind
pastebin the error message here instead
1. goto paste.ubuntu.com 2. paste into text field there 3. get url result and paste it here
i posted it in a textfile: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/642705/nautilus.txt
restarting nautilus worked
i wonder what it was though
errors are a symptom of runnin nautilus from commandline.. don't worry about them
not relevant to your problem
i'll see if it reappears but for now it's fine.. thanks alot mate
welcome
